Key Match Events: Tyrese Haliburton scored 31 points as the Indiana Pacers rebounded from a 37-point loss to Boston by winning the rematch 123-114.
Andrew Nembhard returned after missing Friday’s game with tendinitis in his left knee and added 17 points, eight rebounds, and eight assists for the Pacers.
Jaylen Brown led Boston with 31 points and six assists.
The Celtics had whittled an 11-point deficit to 105-103 on Tatum’s three-point play with 7:38 to play before the Pacers scored the next 13 points over nearly two minutes to take control.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Rick Carlisle wanted to see his team respond by getting off to a physical start after a blowout loss.
The Pacers went inside instead of settling for jumpers and outscored Boston 66-48 in the paint to make up for the loss of injured forward Obi Toppin (sprained left ankle).
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics lost their sixth game at home already this season. Last season, they went 37-4 at TD Garden during the regular season and 9-2 in the playoffs en route to the NBA championship.
Indiana made 22 free throws to just 16 for Boston.
